org.osmdroid.views.overlay

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Overlay
      • org.osmdroid.views.overlay.OverlayWithIW
        • org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Polygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OverlayConstants

    public class Polygon
extends OverlayWithIW
    A polygon on the earth's surface that can have a popup-InfoWindow (a bubble). Mimics the Polygon class from Google Maps Android API v2 as much as possible. Main differences:
    - Doesn't support: Z-Index, Geodesic mode
    - Supports InfoWindow.
    See Also:
    Google Maps Polygon

      • setInfoWindow

        public void setInfoWindow(InfoWindow infoWindow)
        Set the InfoWindow to be used. Default is a BasicInfoWindow, with the layout named "bonuspack_bubble". You can use this method either to use your own layout, or to use your own sub-class of InfoWindow. If you don't want any InfoWindow to open, you can set it to null.
        Overrides:
        setInfoWindow in class OverlayWithIW
        Parameters:
        infoWindow - the InfoWindow to be opened when tapping the overlay. This InfoWindow MUST be able to handle an OverlayWithIW (as BasicInfoWindow does). Set it to null to remove an existing InfoWindow.

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints(List<GeoPoint> points)
        Set the points of the polygon outline. Note that a later change in the original points List will have no effect. To remove/change points, you must call setPoints again. If geodesic mode has been set, the long segments will follow the earth "great circle".

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(GeoPoint p)
        Add the point at the end of the polygon outline. If geodesic mode has been set, the long segments will follow the earth "great circle".

      • setHoles

        public void setHoles(List<? extends List<GeoPoint>> holes)

        returns a copy of the holes this polygon contains
        Returns:
        never null

      • draw

                 Projection pj)
        Overrides:
        draw in class Overlay

      • showInfoWindow

        public void showInfoWindow()
        Show the infowindow, if any. It will be opened either at the latest location, if any, or to a default location computed by setDefaultInfoWindowLocation method. Note that you can manually set this location with: setInfoWindowLocation

      • contains

        public boolean contains(MotionEvent event)
        Important note: this function returns correct results only if the Polygon has been drawn before, and if the MapView positioning has not changed.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Returns:
        true if the Polygon contains the event position.

      • onSingleTapConfirmed

        public boolean onSingleTapConfirmed(MotionEvent event,
                                    MapView mapView)
        Default listener for a single tap event on a Polygon: set the infowindow at the tapped position, and open the infowindow (if any).
        Overrides:
        onSingleTapConfirmed in class Overlay
        Parameters:
        event -
        mapView -
        Returns:
        true if tapped

      • getInfoWindowLocation

        public GeoPoint getInfoWindowLocation()
        Returns:
        the geopoint location where the infowindow should point at. Doesn't matter if the infowindow is currently opened or not.
        Since:
        6.0.0

      • setDefaultInfoWindowLocation

        protected void setDefaultInfoWindowLocation()
        Internal method used to ensure that the infowindow will have a default position in all cases, so that the user can call showInfoWindow even if no tap occured before. Currently, set the position on the center of the polygon bounding box.

      • setInfoWindowLocation

        public void setInfoWindowLocation(GeoPoint location)
        Sets the info window anchor point to a geopoint location
        Parameters:
        location -
        Since:
        6.0.0
